docs.title: Nice work!
docs.text: Now this is complety redundant For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Using Markup Language
docs.text: it is very easy to use, no HTML required

docs.title: MkDocs is simple to setup and Markup Language is super simple

lists

docs.title: Plain Codeblock
docs.text:
Just a plain block of highlighted code

def index(request):
  return render(request, 'index.html')
//comment: somerandom code

docs.title: Python Codeblock
docs.text:
Here is some code with py at the start

def index(request):
  return render(request, 'index.html')

docs.title: With a Title
docs.text:
Sort a list of strings.
my_list = ["blue", "red", "green"]

my_list.sort() 
my_list = sorted(my_list, key=len)  

import locale
from functools import cmp_to_key
my_list = sorted(my_list, key=cmp_to_key(locale.strcoll))

docs.title: With line numbers
docs.text:
Checking if a file exists.
#Checking if a file exists in two ways
#1- Using the OS module
import os 
exists = os.path.isfile('/path/to/file')

#2- Use the pathlib module for a better performance
from pathlib import Path
config = Path('/path/to/file') 
if config.is_file(): 
    pass

docs.title: Highlighting lines
docs.text:
Using F strings.
 #Formatting strings with f string.
str_val = 'books'
num_val = 15
print(f'{num_val} {str_val}') # 15 books
print(f'{num_val % 2 = }') # 1
print(f'{str_val!r}') # books

 #Dealing with floats
price_val = 5.18362
print(f'{price_val:.2f}') # 5.18

 #Formatting dates
from datetime import datetime;
date_val = datetime.utcnow()
print(f'{date_val=:%Y-%m-%d}') # date_val=2023-12-09

docs.text: it is very easy to use, no HTML required
